Potential Roles And Responsibilities

  • Protectors: Frontliners protect crowds from police advancements and projectiles using sturdy shields and sturdy umbrellas. A frontliner should hold great physical and mental strength as a lot of responsibility falls upon them. White frontliners are less likely to be treated poorly by police.
  • Peaceful Protestors: These peacekeepers keep the energy and rhythm of a protest moving by leading chants and helping with crowd communication. One may display protest signs with appropriate messaging and demands. Peaceful protestors may record acts of police aggression and may take note of police tactics and weaponry.
  • Combat Crew: Protestors who use flashlights or laser pointers to blind cameras, blind drones, and blind a police’s line of sight or to use them to signal police locations. One may throw water bottles, umbrellas, and trash to deny police advancement. One may also use water and traffic cones to extinguish teargas canisters.
  • Medic: People with various medic expertise who treat injured protestors or those who get hit with gas or pepper spray. Medics shouldn’t perform any procedure that they’re not comfortable with.
